title: Risk assessment
fullText:
Before commencing inspection and testing, a site-specific risk assessment is required to identify risks and establish control methods.
The risk assessment and resulting control measures should consider the following:
(a) The age and condition of the equipment being tested that may expose additional hazards.
(b) Requirements of the regulatory authorities for the jurisdiction.
(c) The safe work practices in work, health and safety legislation and as outlined in AS/NZS 4836.
(d) Use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) that is suitable for the inspection and testing task.
(e) Wearing of conductive body adornments and devices
(f) Equipment and material containing asbestos.
